intro: Boechera glareosa, commonly known as the shining rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Boechera glareosa is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
